While the private sector may not be as directly involved in peace and security or gender-related issues as NGOs or international organizations, there are companies and consultancies that work in related fields and offer competitive wages. These firms often focus on risk analysis, international development, security consulting, or corporate social responsibility, and they may address gender and peace-related topics as part of their work. Here are some examples:

1. Control Risks: Control Risks is a global risk consultancy that provides services related to political, security, and integrity risks. They offer competitive wages and opportunities to work on projects related to international security and development. Visit their website at <https://www.controlrisks.com/>.
2. RAND Corporation: RAND is a nonprofit global policy think tank that conducts research and analysis in various areas, including peace and security, international development, and gender issues. They offer competitive wages and opportunities for researchers and analysts. Visit their website at <https://www.rand.org/>.
3. Chemonics International: Chemonics is an international development consulting firm that works on projects funded by donors like USAID. They often address gender and peace-related issues as part of their work in various sectors. Visit their website at <https://www.chemonics.com/>.
4. Palladium International: Palladium is a global consultancy that focuses on international development, strategy, and impact investing. They work on projects related to gender, peace, and security in various contexts. Check their website at <https://www.thepalladiumgroup.com/>.
5. Kroll: Kroll is a global risk management firm that provides investigative, intelligence, and security services. They may address peace and security issues as part of their work on political and security risk analysis. Visit their website at <https://www.kroll.com/>.
6. Deloitte: Deloitte, one of the "Big Four" accounting firms, offers consulting services related to international development, sustainability, and corporate social responsibility, which may address gender and peace-related topics. Check their website at <https://www2.deloitte.com/>.

These companies offer competitive wages and opportunities to work on projects related to peace and security, international development, and gender issues. When searching for job opportunities, look for positions within their international development, risk analysis, or sustainability departments, as these are more likely to address gender and peace-related topics.
